Detailed Description

Utility sorting Boxes into tree-like form for finding box overlaps.

This class recursively splits a set of Boxes into tree-like form and stores them for fast searches. The recursive splitting stops when the number of boxes in a leaf node of the tree is less than a minimum number specified in the constructor.

All mapped boxes in a BoxTree must exist in the same index space. This means that the must all have the same BlockId value.

Overlap searches are done by

  • hasOverlap()
  • findOverlapBoxes()

Information about the boxes in the tree are given by

  • getBoundingBox()
  • getBoxes()

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SAMRAI::hier::BoxTree::BoxTree ( const tbox::Dimension &  dim  )  [explicit]

Constructor building an uninitialized object.

The object can be initialized using generateTree().

Parameters:
[in] dim 

SAMRAI::hier::BoxTree::BoxTree ( const tbox::Dimension &  dim,
const BoxContainer &  mapped_boxes,
int  min_number = 10 
) [explicit]

Constructs a BoxTree from set of Boxes.

Parameters:
[in] dim 
[in] mapped_boxes. No empty boxes are allowed. An assertion failure will occur if the mapped boxes in this input set do not all have the same BlockId.
[in] min_number Split up sets of boxes while the number of boxes in a subset is greater than this value. Setting to a larger value tends to make tree building faster but tree searching slower, and vice versa. Default: 10

SAMRAI::hier::BoxTree::BoxTree ( const tbox::Dimension &  dim,
const BoxContainer &  boxes,
const BlockId &  block_id,
int  min_number = 10 
) [explicit]

Constructs a BoxTree from a list of Boxes.

See BoxTree( const tbox::Dimension& , const BoxContainer& , int min_number );

Parameters:
[in] dim 
[in] boxes No empty boxes are allowed.
[in] block_id The BlockId that will be assigned to every Box in the tree.
[in] min_number Default: 10

Member Function Documentation

void SAMRAI::hier::BoxTree::generateTree ( BoxContainer &  mapped_boxes,
int  min_number = 10 
)

Generates the tree from a MUTABLE set of Boxes.

For efficiency reasons, mapped_boxes is changed in the process. Its output state is undefined. However, you can change mapped_boxes after tree generation without invalidating the tree.

Parameters:
[in] mapped_boxes. No empty boxes are allowed.
[in] min_number 

void SAMRAI::hier::BoxTree::clear (  ) 

Reset to uninitialized state.

The dimension of boxes in the tree cannot be changed.

Uninitialized trees can be initialized using generateTree().

bool SAMRAI::hier::BoxTree::isInitialized (  )  const

Check whether the tree has been initialized.

Uninitialized trees can be initialized using generateTree().

bool SAMRAI::hier::BoxTree::hasOverlap ( const Box &  box  )  const

Whether the given box has an overlap with Boxes in the tree.

Parameters:
[in] box The box is assumed to be in same index space as those in the tree.

void SAMRAI::hier::BoxTree::findOverlapBoxes ( Connector &  overlap_connector,
const Box &  box,
bool  recursive_call = false 
) const

Find all boxes that overlap the given box.

Parameters:
[out] overlap_connector Overlap Connector with box in its base BoxLevel.
[in] box the specified box whose overlaps are requested. The box is assumed to be in same index space as those in the tree.

void SAMRAI::hier::BoxTree::findOverlapBoxes ( std::vector< Box > &  overlap_mapped_boxes,
const Box &  box,
bool  recursive_call = false 
) const

Find all boxes that overlap the given box.

To avoid unneeded work, the output overlap_mapped_boxes container is not emptied. Overlapping Boxes are simply added.

Output is unsorted.

Parameters:
[out] overlap_mapped_boxes Boxes that overlap with box.
[in] box the specified box whose overlaps are requested. The box is assumed to be in same index space as those in the tree.

void SAMRAI::hier::BoxTree::findOverlapBoxes ( std::vector< const Box * > &  overlap_mapped_boxes,
const Box &  box,
bool  recursive_call = false 
) const

Find all boxes that overlap the given box.

Analogous to findOverlapBoxes returning a vector of Boxes but avoids the copies. If the returned overlapped mapped boxes are used in a context in which the BoxTree is constant there is no point in incurring the cost of copying the tree's Boxes. Just return a vector of their addresses.

Parameters:
[out] overlap_mapped_boxes Pointers to Boxes that overlap with box.
[in] box the specified box whose overlaps are requested. The box is assumed to be in same index space as those in the tree.

void SAMRAI::hier::BoxTree::findOverlapBoxes ( BoxContainer &  overlap_boxes,
const Box &  box,
bool  recursive_call = false 
) const

Find all boxes that overlap the given box.

To avoid unneeded work, the output overlap_boxes container is not emptied. Overlapping Boxes are simply added.

Output is unsorted.

Parameters:
[out] overlap_boxes Boxes that overlap with box.
[in] box the specified box whose overlaps are requested. The box is assumed to be in same index space as those in the tree.

tbox::Pointer< BoxTree > SAMRAI::hier::BoxTree::createRefinedTree ( const IntVector &  ratio  )  const

Create a similar tree with the boxes refined by a given ratio.

Parameters:
[in] ratio The boxes are refined by this ratio.
Note that there is no coresponding version to create a coarsened tree. Coarsened trees cannot be trivially generated like refined trees can. To create a coarsened tree, you must manually get the boxes, coarsen them and use them to build a new tree.
